result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy L. Thompson

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order
Jury trial - 12 person on April 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Final pre-trial on March 16, 2023 at 10:30 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

3:19 PM Defendant Roy L. Thompson appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Roy L. Thompson. Set for trial allowing 2 days.

Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for STC 5/2 @ 3 PM.

3:35 PM Defendant Roy L. Thompson appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Roy L. Thompson. Defendant understands and agrees to appear remotely, State in compliance.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

Waiver of Prelim on March 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:16 PM Defendant Roy L. Thompson appeared by video, Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Roy L. Thompson, Attorney Emily Hynek appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. STC date set for 3/7 @ 3 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Any victims listed in the complaint or their residence, or the location where the incident occurred. 

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 

Defendant is prohibited from possessing firearms.

12:59 PM Defendant Roy L. Thompson appeared by video, in custody from Jackson County Jail, Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Roy L. Thompson, Attorney Crystal Jensen appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended complaint filed adding bases for repeater allegations. State is in compliance with victim rights. Defense asking to amend to  $2000.00 cash bond. State objects.

Status conference on January 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
